content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's how you could do it in Julia:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Date(d).year * 100 + Date(d).month for d in df.dt]
end
```
This function uses the `Dates` module to convert each `DateTime` into a `Date`, which only keeps the year and month when using `.year` and `.month`. It then multiplies these values together, effectively concatenating them into a single integer. Note that this assumes all dates in the column are valid and do not contain any time information.
